As a matter of fact, systematic and timely evaluation of its programmes, activities, instruments, legislation and non-spending activities is a priority of the European Commission in order to demonstrate accountability and to promote lesson learning to improve policy and practice.

The generic purpose of the evaluation is to identify key lessons and to produce recommendations to improve current and inform future choices on the sector reform contracts in Ukraine and on the cooperation between the EU in Ukraine in the sphere of the removal of technical barriers in the trade in industrial goods.

Project duration: 130 days (until May 2017)

Category I Expertise in Evaluation – 50 working days

Qualifications and skills

  • Master’s degree in a field related to the assignment – economic, legal, financial, international relations, engineering etc. or at least extra 5 years of experience additional to that described below under the general professional experience;
  • be proficient in English (level C1 in reading, speaking and writing);
  • have excellent communication and analytical skills;
  • be capable using modern IT technologies;
  • excellent writing skills;
  • Working knowledge of Ukrainian or Russian (at least level B2) will be an advantage.

General Professional experience

  • at least 12 years of professional experience gained after obtaining the higher education diploma;

Specific professional experience:

  • at least seven years of experience in development cooperation;
  • proven experience in at least three evaluations;
  • Experience in budget support implementation or evaluation will be an asset.
